poem:
A Modern Alibi

Keys pressed down  
by weightless hand,  
a silent room hums  
the façade of work—  
each keystroke,  
phantom labor,  
a click echoing  
within untraveled walls.  
Deception's light,  
thin clarity unspun:  
caught in the whisper  
of untrue diligence,  
unseen fingers  
tap her fate.  
The truth  
rings real,  
revealed.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Somerset detective sacked for pretending to work from home A detective working on child protection, who was found to have weighed down the keys on her laptop to give the impression she was working at home, has been sacked without notice for gross misconduct after a disciplinary hearing. Suspicions were raised when keystroke data – the record of the number of times the keys had been struck on the keyboard – revealed DC Philippa Baskwill". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Somerset detective sacked for pretending to work from home A detective working on child protection, who was found to have weighed down the keys on her laptop to give the impression she was working at home, has been sacked without notice for gross misconduct after a disciplinary hearing. Suspicions were raised when keystroke data – the record of the number of times the keys had been struck on the keyboard – revealed DC Philippa Baskwill
